metadata.title: CVE-2016-20022 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 4.8, usb_parse_endpoint indrivers/usb/core/config.c does not validate the wMaxPacketSize field of anendpoint descriptor. NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products thatare no longer supported by the supplier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-20022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-42.62~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
